title: Authors and Citation
text: Sam Gardiner. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Gardiner S (2024). ozgs: Access Australian Statistical Geography Standard. R package version 0.0.1, https://gardiners.github.io/ozgs/, https://github.com/gardiners/ozgs.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ozgs: Access the Australian Statistical Geography Standard},   author = {Sam Gardiner},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.1, https://gardiners.github.io/ozgs/},   url = {https://github.com/gardiners/ozgs}, }

what: Access the Australian Statistical Geography Standard
title: Access the Australian Statistical Geography Standard
text: ozgs fetches caches sf geometries data Australian Statistical Geography Standard (ASGS) web service.

title: Access the Australian Statistical Geography Standard
text: can install development version ozgs GitHub : r-universe :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("gardiners/ozgs") install.packages('ozgs', repos = c('https://gardiners.r-universe.dev',                                    'https://cloud.r-project.org'))

title: Access the Australian Statistical Geography Standard
text: Every geometry published ABS every edition ASGS (1, 2 3) currently available ozgs. include Indigenous Structure, Statistical Areas (SA1, SA2, SA3 SA4), states territories, postcode approximations (POAs), suburbs localities, local government areas (LGAs), state federal electoral divisions, Remoteness Structure mesh blocks constructed. ozgs uses arcgislayersüì¶ easy querying, filtering spatial queries.

title: Access the Australian Statistical Geography Standard
text: Requests cached avoid repeatedly fetching large quantities data ABS servers. default, ozgs creates simple memory cache using cachem::cache_mem(), persists current session. persistently store ASGS geometries locally (elsewhere), can use cachem-compatible cache function.

title: Access the Australian Statistical Geography Standard
text: Plot Tasmania‚Äôs coastlines, using data 1st edition ASGS:  Fetch every 3rd-edition SA1 intersects Sydney Local Government Area, extent 2023:  Store cached geometries within working directory reuse sessions (especially helpful ‚Äôre working RMarkdown Quarto, start fresh session render): , set ozgs.cache option use everywhere script, effect:
code: library(ozgs) library(ggplot2)  theme_set(theme_void())  tas <- get_geography("STE", edition = 1, where = "STE_NAME = 'Tasmania'")  ggplot(tas) +   geom_sf() sydney_lga <- get_geography("LGA",                             reference_date = 2023,                             where = "LGA_NAME_2023 = 'Sydney'")  sydney_sa1 <- get_geography("SA1",                             edition = 3,                             filter_geom = sydney_lga$geometry) #> ! `filter_geom` cannot be a "MULTIPOLYGON" geometry. #> ‚Ñπ Using `sf::st_union()` and `sf::st_cast()` to create a "POLYGON" for #>   `filter_geom`.  ggplot(sydney_sa1) +   geom_sf() project_cache <- cachem::cache_disk("./readme_cache") aus <- get_geography("AUS", edition = 3, cache = project_cache) options("ozgs.cache" = cachem::cache_disk("./readme_cache"))

title: Australian Drainage Division (ADDs) ‚Äî add
text: Fetch ASGS geometries Australian Drainage Division (ADDs).

title: Australian Drainage Division (ADDs) ‚Äî add
code: add(   edition = NULL,   reference_date = NULL,   layer = c("gen", "full", "point"),   where = NULL,   filter_geom = NULL,   predicate = c("intersects", "contains", "crosses", "overlaps", "touches", "within"),   cache = getOption("ozgs.cache"),   ... )

title: Australian Drainage Division (ADDs) ‚Äî add
text: edition ASGS edition: 1, 2, 3. reference_date geography's year release. geographies, reference_year optional specifying edition sufficient. However, LGAs, CEDs SEDs, ASGS contains multiple releases per edition. geographies, reference_date must supplied uniquely identify release. layer One : "gen", default. Fetches simplified geometries generalised 0.000025¬∞ 2.5m. "full", full ASGS geometries. Identical ASGS Shapefile Geopackage downloads. "point", point geometries records geography. optional SQL clause filter records returned request. filter_geom optional sf::sfc single sf geometry filter records returned request. predicate optional spatial predicate specify relation filter_geom geography. One "intersects", "contains", "crosses", "overlaps", "touches", "within". cache cachem-compatible cache. otherwise specified, defaults memory cache. persistently store downloaded ASGS geometries data, supply object created cachem::cache_disk(). ... Additional arguments passed arcgislayers::arc_read().

title: Australian Drainage Division (ADDs) ‚Äî add
text: following combinations ASGS edition reference_date available:

what: Get a geography from the ASGS web service ‚Äî get_geography
title: Get a geography from the ASGS web service ‚Äî get_geography
text: get_geography() downloads caches geometries data defined specified ASGS geography, optional filtering using SQL spatial queries.

title: Get a geography from the ASGS web service ‚Äî get_geography
code: get_geography(   geography,   edition = NULL,   reference_date = NULL,   layer = c("gen", "full", "point"),   where = NULL,   filter_geom = NULL,   predicate = c("intersects", "contains", "crosses", "overlaps", "touches", "within"),   cache = getOption("ozgs.cache"),   ... )

title: Get a geography from the ASGS web service ‚Äî get_geography
text: geography name ASGS geography download. Valid choices ADD, AUS, CED, DZN, GCCSA, IARE, ILOC, IREG, LGA, MB, NRMR, POA, RA, S, SA1, SA2, SA3, SA4, ..., TR, UCL. edition ASGS edition: 1, 2, 3. reference_date geography's year release. geographies, reference_year optional specifying edition sufficient. However, LGAs, CEDs SEDs, ASGS contains multiple releases per edition. geographies, reference_date must supplied uniquely identify release. layer One : "gen", default. Fetches simplified geometries generalised 0.000025¬∞ 2.5m. "full", full ASGS geometries. Identical ASGS Shapefile Geopackage downloads. "point", point geometries records geography. optional SQL clause filter records returned request. filter_geom optional sf::sfc single sf geometry filter records returned request. predicate optional spatial predicate specify relation filter_geom geography. One "intersects", "contains", "crosses", "overlaps", "touches", "within". cache cachem-compatible cache. otherwise specified, defaults memory cache. persistently store downloaded ASGS geometries data, supply object created cachem::cache_disk(). ... Additional arguments passed arcgislayers::arc_read().

title: Get a geography from the ASGS web service ‚Äî get_geography
text: Returns sf spatial data frame geometry data requested ASGS geography.
